Jericho - Chapter 1
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Completed Epics Section I: Jericho - Chapter 1
By PezCat on Tuesday, April 18, 2000 - 02:05 pm:

"Thanks again, Chase."
"Not a problem. I'm just glad they haven't figured out who flies that thing yet," Chase said, pointing his thumb back at the Odd Duck. "If they had, my 'legitimate' shipping business would be over in a heartbeat!" Chase snorted a brief laugh. "Hell, far as they know, I'm a perfect little citizen from Coruscant. Pay all my taxes on time and everything. Sh**, I've even
been hit by that bastard in the Odd Duck a couple times, costs me a fortune!"
Jericho and the Rebel officer had a laugh and shook hands one last time as Chase turned to head back to the Odd Duck.
"You bandits ready to go?" Chase yelled out to his crew. It was a short stay on Yavin 4, but
once the group left, it was off to Bespin for awhile, where they were going to have a little time off.
"Thank God," Chase thought to himself. "I NEED a break... and Dan'Tiree and I haven't had any real time alone in almost a month. I can tell it's bugging her too... but we're almost there, love. Then I'm yours alone for a month."
"Unless the fuzzball and his lover have an objection, we are," the dark-haired lady said.
Dan'Tiree looked rather stunning for a lady who had worked her way from foot-soldier to Lieutenant for the Rebel Alliance in only 4-1/2 years... and for a lady who could effortlessly rip a man's throat out if he did the wrong thing or worked for the wrong people.
The Ewok tried to kick Dan'Tiree in the shin, but the lady dodged the fuzzy foot before cuffing the Ewok across the back of the head.
"C'mon you two. Save it for Bespin. We'll have a month for that later," Chase said, noticing
Dan'Tiree raising an eyebrow at him after that comment. "Or for other things," Chase quickly amended, blushing slightly before returning the subtle grin Dan'Tiree had sent him after he had corrected himself.
The crew all piled into the Odd Duck, taking their positions. Chase sat in the pilot's seat,
Bob in the co-pilot's spot. Dan'Tiree sat at the navigation computer behind Chase. Yana, the jawa, smooched Bob (as Chase averted his eyes) before heading off to the engineering bay with Gramps, the Assassin Droid. The Ex-Stormtrooper sat up in the cockpit area with the
rest of the group.
"Ever been to Bespin, Dion?" The smuggler asked the former Imperial soldier.
"Nope. You?"
"Just once. Hope Lando's still in charge out there in Cloud City!"
"Calrissian?" Dion and Dan'Tiree both squeaked in alarm.
"Yep. Old friend of mine," Chase grinned as the ship took off.
The Odd Duck left Yavin 4, then the Yavin system altogether. As soon as they were clear of
the Rebel patrols, the Odd Duck tore into hyperspace, headed for Bespin.
